I hadn't gotten a compootis into 2 years ago, but before that, I had seem, heard so much about Tf2 and I couldn't wait to play it. When I got my PC, I immediately made a Steam account and got TF2, AND ITS AMAZING.  The gameplay, the characters, the community, the story told within comics and animated shorts. Honestly, this is one of the best games out there, and the fact that its free makes it better.

Hey look buddy, I'm an engineer. That means I solve problems, not problems like "what is beauty?" Because that would fall within the perveiw of your conundrums of philosophy. I solve practical problems, for instance: how am I going to stop some mean mother Hubbard from tearing me a structurally superfluous be-hind? The answer, use a gun, and if that don't work... Use more gun.

10/10

Playing TF2 is turning yourself into a ticking time bomb. You either get pissed off instantly because of the bots, or you get pissed off from other dumb stuff like random crits, unbalanced teams and no class limits.

But no matter what happens, you're still gonna be playing the next day because you're a hopeless addict. This totally isn't a cry for help, I'm not trying to imply anything here at all.
